ns1:UMLClass.description: A therapeutic agent (drug, intervention therapy) used in a clinical trail protocol.

ns84:UMLAttribute.description: The name of the agent object.
ns84:UMLAttribute.name: name

ns84:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ns84:UMLAttribute.description: The NCI's internal identification number for the object.
ns84:UMLAttribute.name: NSCNumber

ns84:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A unique drug identifier issued by the Nomenclature Standards Committee of the U.S. Food and Drug Administration.

ns84:UMLAttribute.description: The NCI's Enterprise Vocabulary Services (EVS) identification number.
ns84:UMLAttribute.name: EVSId

ns84:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A concept unique identifier within the NCI Enterprise Vocabulary Service's NCI Thesaurus.

ns84:UMLAttribute.description: The comment for the agent object.
ns84:UMLAttribute.name: comment

ns84:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: Comments; a written explanation or criticism or illustration that is added to a book or other textual material.

ns84:UMLAttribute.description: If the object is CMAP agent.
ns84:UMLAttribute.name: isCMAPAgent

ns84:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A therapeutic agent (drug, intervention therapy) used in a clinical trial protocol.

An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true. The indicator usually takes the form of a single binary digit, or bit (either 0 or 1). (from Dictionary of Computers)

Through the Cancer Molecular Analysis Project (CMAP), NCI facilitates the identification and evaluation of molecular targets by integrating comprehensive molecular characterizations of cancer and making the data and infrastructure publicly accessible. CMAP permits investigators to 1) Discover molecular targets, 2) Assess their validity and interaction with other targets, 3) Determine if there are therapeutic agents that can act on specific targets, 4) Screen for possible toxicity, and 5) Determine whether there are clinical trials evaluating these agents. (http://plan2005.cancer.gov/bioinformatics.html)

ns84:UMLAttribute.description: The identifier attached to this record in the caBIO database
ns84:UMLAttribute.name: id

ns84:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ns85:SemanticMetadata.conceptDefinition: A therapeutic agent (drug, intervention therapy) used in a clinical trial protocol.
